intro: Ochna huillensis, commonly known as the Huillén ochna, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Ochnaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow or orange flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, montane forests and is known for its woody structure and compound leaves. Ochna huillensis produces small, fleshy fruits that are an important food source for local wildlife. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
